titleStmt.title: A notable and prodigious historie of a mayden who for sundry yeeres neither eateth, drinketh, nor sleepeth, neyther auoydeth any excrements, and yet liueth. A matter sufficiently opened and auerred, by the proceedings, examinations, and dilligent informations thereof, taken ex officio by the magistrate. And since by the order of the said magistrate printed and published in high Dutch, and after in French, and nowe lastlie translated into English. 1589.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by [J. Charlewood for] Iohn Woofe,

notesStmt.note: With an attestation by Conrad Colb, i.e. Kolb, of Wartemburg, and others--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
